metadata.case_name: Dwarkadas Mukundas & Ors. v. State Bank of Hyderabad

facts.text: Appellants are Jagirdars and members of a joint family firm with prior money transactions with the Bank on three separate accounts.

Amounts due on three prior accounts totalled Rs. 5,00,000: (a) Rs. 2,59,436-0-0 on L.B.D. Account; (b) Rs. 2,05,358-8-8 on Overdraft Account Clean Ledger No. 14 Dwarkadas Mukandas; (c) Rs. 35,205-7-4 on Overdraft Account Clean Ledger No. 2 Dwarkadas Mukundas.

On 8-8-1953, at appellants' request, Bank granted cash credit of Rs. 5,00,000 secured by mortgage deed Ex. P-10 executed by appellants in favour of Bank, mortgaging immovable properties without possession.
From the fresh cash credit account opened on 8-8-1953, appellants cleared liabilities under the three prior accounts, which were closed on the same date.
On 8-8-1953, Bank returned to appellants thirteen bills duly endorsed in their favour.

First defendant (Karta) caused 5th defendant (respondent 2) to guarantee the amount; 5th defendant executed promissory note for Rs. 5,00,000 on 26-9-1953 endorsed to Bank and separate guarantee on same date.
Defendants failed to pay amounts due under mortgage terms.
First respondent Bank filed suit for recovery of Rs. 5,00,000 against appellants (defendants 1-4) and others.
1st defendant remained ex parte; 5th defendant appeared but filed no written statement and remained ex parte; defendants 2-4 filed written statements resisting suit.
Trial court decreed suit against appellants and second respondent, holding debt was post-notification and s.3 of Act exempted Scheduled Banks.
High Court confirmed trial court's judgment and decree following Full Bench decision.
Hyderabad Jagirdars Debt Settlement Act 1952 notified date for s.11 applications: 30-6-1953.
Abolition of Jagirs affected Jagirdars' resources via Hyderabad Abolition of Jagirs Regulation 1358F (1949 AD) and Hyderabad Jagirs Commutation Regulation 1359F (1950 AD, passed 25-1-1950).

legal_issues.text: Whether the debts were extinguished under section 22 of the Hyderabad Jagirdars Debt Settlement Act 1952 as no application was made by Bank under section 11 before 30-6-1953.
Whether Civil Court had jurisdiction to try the suit or if it had to be transferred to Jagirdars Debt Settlement Board under section 25 of the Act.
Whether section 3 of the Act exempting Scheduled Banks is ultra vires Article 14 of the Constitution.
Whether the mortgage deed created a fresh debt or merely secured prior debts, rendering it unenforceable for lack of consideration.

petitioner_arguments.text: Suit debts extinguished under s.22 as no application under s.11 before 30-6-1953.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Hyderabad Jagirdars Debt Settlement Act 1952 ss.11, 22

petitioner_arguments.text: Civil Court lacked jurisdiction under s.25; suit to be transferred to Debt Settlement Board.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Hyderabad Jagirdars Debt Settlement Act 1952 s.25

petitioner_arguments.text: Prior debts were pending on notified date; mortgage secured those debts, lacks consideration as prior debts extinguished.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Hyderabad Jagirdars Debt Settlement Act 1952 ss.11, 25

petitioner_arguments.text: Section 3 exempting Scheduled Banks ultra vires Art.14.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Article 14, State of Rajasthan v. Mukand Chand

respondent_arguments.text: Debt was post-notification fresh cash credit loan of Rs. 5,00,000 on 8-8-1953; prior accounts closed by payment therefrom.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Hyderabad Jagirdars Debt Settlement Act 1952; mortgage deed terms

respondent_arguments.text: As Scheduled Bank, provisions of Act not applicable by virtue of s.3.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Hyderabad Jagirdars Debt Settlement Act 1952 s.3(v)

court_reasoning.text: Mortgage created fresh debt of Rs. 5,00,000 on 8-8-1953 after 30-6-1953; prior debts discharged by payment from new loan; 13 bills returned.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Unimpeachable evidence accepted by both courts; mortgage terms show fresh debt with repayment schedule.

court_reasoning.text: No plea raised in trial or appellate court that mortgage lacked consideration or prior debts extinguished; general plea in written statement insufficient; no issue framed; cannot raise first time in Supreme Court.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Prayer in para 9 of written statement general; 75 grounds in memo of appeal but none on this.

court_reasoning.text: S.25 applies only to proceedings pending on 30-6-1953 re debts where s.11 application could be made; post-notification suits not transferable unless notice by Board.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Following Full Bench in State Bank of Hyderabad v. Mukundas Raja Bhagawandas.

court_reasoning.text: Debt not extinguished under s.22 as fresh post-notification debt; s.11 material date is notified date for pre-existing debts.
court_reasoning.key_observation: S.22 extinguishes debts only if no s.11 application for those due on or before notified date.

holdings.text: Mortgage deed created fresh enforceable debt post-notification; prior debts discharged.
Civil Court had jurisdiction; suit not transferable under s.25.

precedents_cited.case_name: State Bank of Hyderabad v. Mukundas Raja Bhagawandas and Sons
precedents_cited.relevance: Full Bench holding on s.25 transferability of pre vs post-notification suits/proceedings.

precedents_cited.case_name: State of Rajasthan v. Mukand Chand
precedents_cited.relevance: Art.14 challenge to exemption provision analogous to s.3.

statutes_cited.name: Hyderabad Jagirdars Debt Settlement Act 1952
statutes_cited.relevance: Core provisions on applicability to Scheduled Banks, applications to Board, extinguishment of debts, jurisdiction/transfer to Board.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Challenged for discrimination in s.3 exemption.

statutes_cited.relevance: Background on abolition affecting Jagirdars' resources.

statutes_cited.name: Hyderabad Jagirs Commutation Regulation
statutes_cited.relevance: Background on commutation affecting Jagirdars' resources.

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed confirming trial court decree for recovery on mortgage; appellants directed to pay half decretal amount with interest within 4 months and balance within 8 months thereafter, failing which full execution permissible.
outcome.relief_granted: Payment in instalments: half within 4 months, balance within 8 months, with interest.

key_quotes.text: "the loan of Rs. 5,00,000/- was a fresh debt created by the mortgage deed."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding that debt was post-notification and fresh.

key_quotes.text: "We cannot, therefore, permit the appellant to raise any contention based on the mortgage being unenforceable for want of consideration for the first time in this Court."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "the Civil Court had jurisdiction and the decree granted by the trial court and confirmed by the appellate court does not suffer from any infirmity."
key_quotes.speaker: court
